Package org.myshelfie.model

Class Bookshelf

java.lang.Object
org.myshelfie.model.Bookshelf
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Bookshelf extends Object implements Serializable
This class represents the bookshelf of a player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Bookshelf

      public Bookshelf()
      Bookshelf constructor. It initializes an empty bookshelf.

  • Method Details

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(Tile t, int c) throws WrongArgumentException
      Add a tile in a specific column of the bookshelf, if possible.
      Parameters:
      t - The tile
      c - The index of the column (0 invalid input: '<'= c invalid input: '<' 5)
      Throws:
      WrongArgumentException - if the column is already full

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int r, int c) throws WrongArgumentException
      Retrieves the tile in the specified position, without removing it.
      Parameters:
      r - The row of the bookshelf
      c - The column of the bookshelf
      Returns:
      The tile in (r, c)
      Throws:
      WrongArgumentException - If (r, c) is out of bounds

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight(int c) throws WrongArgumentException
      Method that returns the height of a certain column of the bookshelf intended as the number of non-null tiles in it.
      Parameters:
      c - Column of interest
      Returns:
      The height of the column c inside this Bookshelf
      Throws:
      WrongArgumentException

    • getMinHeight

      public int getMinHeight() throws WrongArgumentException
      Method that cheks all the columns and returns the height of the shortest one. This is used in PickTilesCommand.execute() to prevent the player from picking tiles that would make the bookshelf exceed the maximum height.
      Returns:
      The minimum height of the bookshelf
      Throws:
      WrongArgumentException

    • getAdjacentSizes

      public List<Integer> getAdjacentSizes()
      Examines all the bookshelf to produce a list of the sizes of all the standalone groups of adjacent tiles of the same type. This method allows the computing of scoring points related to adjacent tiles.
      Returns:
      The list containing the sizes of all groups

    • getGroupSize

      public int getGroupSize(boolean[][] visited, int row, int col, ItemType targetType)
      Recursive method that allows to compute the size of standalone groups of adjacent tiles of same type. Once checked that the current tile has targetType, size is incremented by one and then incremented by the result of all the recursive calls to all the adjacent tiles.
      Parameters:
      visited - A boolean matrix with same size as tiles[][] used to avoid considering more that once the same tile
      row - The row index
      col - The column index
      targetType - ItemType of the group's tiles
      Returns:
      The size of the subgroup

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the bookshelf is full.
      Returns:
      true if the bookshelf is full, false otherwise
